body.directions: Listen to the audio in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following mathematical calculations result in the number you hear?
body.correct: Bingo! You’ve got it right. The number in the audio is 88. '十 shí' in the middle indicates it’s a two-digit number, while the digits before and after it take the ten’s and one’s place.
body.incorrect: So close… would you like to listen again and pay special attention to the syllable in the middle?

body.quiz: What is the number that you hear?
body.correct: Fantastic job! You’ve got this number in audio 36. “十 shí“ in the middle indicates it’s a two-digit number, while the digits before and after it take the ten’s and one’s place.
body.incorrect: Not quite… please listen again. This time pay attention to the syllable in the middle and try to catch the digits before and after it.

body.quiz: Which of the following best describes the number in the audio?
body.correct: Outstanding work! Since we don’t hear any digit before “十 shí“, that means the 10’s place digit is one, while ”二 èr” is “2” for one’s place, so “12” it is.
body.incorrect: So close… would you like to listen again? This time pay attention if there’s any digit said before “十 shí“

body.quiz: What is the number that you hear?
body.correct: Job well done! Since we don’t hear any more digits after '十 shí,' that means the one’s place digit is zero, while ”九 jiǔ” is “nine” for ten’s place (so it is “90”).
body.incorrect: Oops… would you like to listen again? This time pay attention if there’s any further digit said after “十 shí“
